channel.title: CSS Skin Help
channel.description:
I tried dumping these files into the cstrike folder, and apparently it didn't work. Now, I'm stuck with the "no-texture" purple and black checkerboard skin on all M249's and AK-47's. Also, the consitency for the M249 doesn't let me play on some servers, and I can't use console on my computer, so I can't set consitency to zero. So, what is the best way to alleviate this problem, and how should I install them better?
AK47 [url='https://www.fpsbanana.com/skins/25923']https://www.fpsbanana.com/skins/25923[/url]
SAW [url='https://www.fpsbanana.com/skins/17887']https://www.fpsbanana.com/skins/17887[/url]
Pictards of my woe :frowning: ![cs_assault0000.jpg|690x500](upload://qvs33YG5NyavEnG87WWxF6G3h9h.jpeg) ![cs_assault0001.jpg|690x500](upload://6XwGbu1RbXsNlbWfVGq19SPYUPd.jpeg) ![cs_assault0002.jpg|690x500](upload://1AE38UdXZpA4f0eo6WDynSNnPkj.jpeg) ![cs_assault0003.jpg|690x500](upload://uD2OsJkgMEUydZnBGIHkCzRmzGz.jpeg)

item.title: CSS Skin Help
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
It will still work if the model is named correctly.

If not, you could always hex edit it so that it will work.

I say put it in the CSS and see if it does.

Read full topic

item.title: CSS Skin Help
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
You know whats amazing.

CSS has the worlds simplest way of putting custom models/textures in, and people still get it wrong.

You have the models in the right spot by the looks of the screenshots, I didnt zoom I’m capped.

The textures are in the wrong spot though, thats why you get the pink and black squares.

To double check, open the CSS dir and find the models for the weapons (counter-strike source\cstrike\models\weapons)

All weapons are there, to make sure the texture is right, it should be in the folder “counter-strike source\cstrike\materials\models\weapons”.

To be perfectly honest though, when your installing a skin (if you call it that) you shouldn’t have to do more then drag the cstike folder from the rar and merge it with your current, compilers should take care of the folder structure before uploading.

Any compiler’s who don’t do it this way yet should be banned from doing it.

Read full topic

item.title: CSS Skin Help
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Alrighty, through dark science and file overwriting, I’ve covered up the ugliness with new skins.

ROUND 2:

I found this awesome model for Source, and I think it would make a rad terrorist replacement (I’m thinking the arctic). Now, it was not primarily made for CSS and it is not meant for any particular model so I can’t just dump it in cstrike, but would it be possible to port it to CSS?

The dude
https://www.fpsbanana.com/models/1407

item.title: CSS Skin Help
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
It’s probably a version conflict. Are you sure those are for the latest version of CS? If all else fails, delete your entire CSS dir and start over. You won’t have to reinstall the game, but you should backup all the custom sound files.

Read full topic

item.title: CSS Skin Help
item.dc:creator: Brother_Shrike
item.description:
Well that’s your problem. It’s disabled by default. Options->Keyboard->Advanced->Enable Developer console.

Can’t help you with your real problem though.

Read full topic

item.description:
